questions.ocrQuestion:
A heated body emits radiation which has maximum intensity near the frequency \( v_{0} \). The emissivity of the material is 0.5 . If the absolute temperature of the body is doubled,
(a) The maximum intensity of radiation will be near the frequency \( 2 v_{0} \)
(b) The maximum intensity of radiation will be near the frequency \( v_{0} / 2 \)
(c) The total energy emitted will increase by a factor of 16
(d) The total energy emitted will increase by a factor of 8
questions.onlyq_text: A heated body emits radiation which has maximum intensity near the frequency \( v_{0} \). The emissivity of the material is 0.5 . If the absolute temperature of the body is doubled,

options.option: (a) The maximum intensity of radiation will be near the frequency \( 2 v_{0} \)
(b) The maximum intensity of radiation will be near the frequency \( v_{0} / 2 \)
(c) The total energy emitted will increase by a factor of 16
(d) The total energy emitted will increase by a factor of 8

questions.ocrQuestion:
A solid sphere and a hollow sphere of the same material and of equal radii are heated to the same temperature.
(a) Both will emit equal amount of radiation per unit time in the beginning.
(b) Both will absorb equal amount of radiation from the surrounding in the beginning.
(c) The initial rate of cooling ( \( d T / d t) \) will be the same for the two spheres.
(d) The two spheres will have equal temperatures at any instant.
questions.onlyq_text: A solid sphere and a hollow sphere of the same material and of equal radii are heated to the same temperature.

options.option: (a) Both will emit equal amount of radiation per unit time in the beginning.
(b) Both will absorb equal amount of radiation from the surrounding in the beginning.
(c) The initial rate of cooling ( \( d T / d t) \) will be the same for the two spheres.
(d) The two spheres will have equal temperatures at any instant.

questions.subject: PHYSICS

questions.ocrQuestion:
Which of the following is correct the form of the Planck radiation formula in the limit for energy density \( \rho(\lambda) \) for wave length \( \lambda \) at absolute temperature \( T \)
(a) \( \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \frac{1}{\exp \left(h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right)-1} \)
(b) \( \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \frac{1}{\exp \left(h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right)+1} \)
(c) For large wave length \( h c / \lambda k_{B} T \ll 1 \quad \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi}{\lambda^{4}} k_{B} T \)
(d) For short wavelength \( h c / \lambda k_{B} T \gg 1 \rho(\lambda)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \exp \left(-h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right) \)
questions.onlyq_text: Which of the following is correct the form of the Planck radiation formula in the limit for energy density \( \rho(\lambda) \) for wave length \( \lambda \) at absolute temperature \( T \)

options.option: (a) \( \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \frac{1}{\exp \left(h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right)-1} \)
(b) \( \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \frac{1}{\exp \left(h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right)+1} \)
(c) For large wave length \( h c / \lambda k_{B} T \ll 1 \quad \rho(\lambda, T)=\frac{8 \pi}{\lambda^{4}} k_{B} T \)
(d) For short wavelength \( h c / \lambda k_{B} T \gg 1 \rho(\lambda)=\frac{8 \pi h c}{\lambda^{5}} \exp \left(-h c / \lambda k_{B} T\right) \)

questions.ocrQuestion:
Which of the following is correct about theory related about black body radiation?
(a) Rayleigh-Jeans theory for intensity of radiation is correct for small wavelength .
(b) Rayleigh-Jeans theory for intensity of radiation is correct for greater wavelength.
(c) Wien's Distribution Law for intensity of radiation is correct for small wavelength.
(d) Wien's Distribution Law for intensity of radiation is correct for greater wavelength.
questions.onlyq_text: Which of the following is correct about theory related about black body radiation?

options.option: (a) Rayleigh-Jeans theory for intensity of radiation is correct for small wavelength .
(b) Rayleigh-Jeans theory for intensity of radiation is correct for greater wavelength.
(c) Wien's Distribution Law for intensity of radiation is correct for small wavelength.
(d) Wien's Distribution Law for intensity of radiation is correct for greater wavelength.

questions.subject: PHYSICS

questions.ocrQuestion:
Which of the following is correct about Plank's theory related about intensity of radiation?
(a) Plank's theory is correct for both smaller and bigger wavelength.
(b) Plank's theory of radiation has basic assumption that Energy of radiation is discrete
(c) Derivation Plank's theory of radiation has same method as Rayleigh-Jeans to calculate number of mode between frequency \( v \) to \( v+d v \)
(d) ) Energy density \( \rho(v) d v \) between frequency \( v \) to \( v+d v \) is \( \frac{8 \pi v^{2}}{c^{3}} \cdot \frac{h v}{\exp \left(\frac{h v}{k_{B} T}\right)-1} \)
questions.onlyq_text: Which of the following is correct about Plank's theory related about intensity of radiation?

options.option: (a) Plank's theory is correct for both smaller and bigger wavelength.
(b) Plank's theory of radiation has basic assumption that Energy of radiation is discrete
(c) Derivation Plank's theory of radiation has same method as Rayleigh-Jeans to calculate number of mode between frequency \( v \) to \( v+d v \)
(d) ) Energy density \( \rho(v) d v \) between frequency \( v \) to \( v+d v \) is \( \frac{8 \pi v^{2}}{c^{3}} \cdot \frac{h v}{\exp \left(\frac{h v}{k_{B} T}\right)-1} \)
